summary:
In Islam, prophets are special people who share God's messages and teach others how to live a good life. There are many prophets, including well-known figures from Judaism and Christianity. The first prophet was Adam, the first human.

The most important prophet in Islam is Muhammad, who received the Quran from God. Muslims believe the Quran is God's exact words, kept safe and unchanged. All prophets taught about God's oneness, worshipping Him, and believing in the Day of Judgment. They were sent to different people at different times.
title: Prophets and messengers in Islam
